 Search 
 Concordia University 
 Graduate admissions 
 GRADUATE LIFE 
 Montreal: A student city 
 Montreal is one of the world's truly great cities. It's also the best city in the world to be a student, partly because we have the highest concentration of students. That means a lifestyle that's affordable, stimulating and fun. 
 Learn more about life in Montreal 
 Campus visits 
 The Welcome Centre is a great place where you can learn more about Concordia and get personalized admissions advice. Arrange a graduate tour and learn what activities, services, and spaces are available for your academic success and personal wellbeing. 
 Book a tour 
 Professional development 
 Graduate success goes far beyond the classroom. Sign up for professional development workshops and acquire fundamental skills that will land you your dream job. 
 GradProSkills 
 Concordia’s Graduate and Professional Skills program offers free workshops that enrich the graduate experience and assist students as they transition into a future career. Benefit from workshops on career building, leadership and management, and software and web tools. 
 Find GradProSkills workshops 
 Oui can help! 
 The French Studies Department’s Oui Can Help! program provides international students with resources to learn and improve their French language skills. Take advantage of courses, conversation groups and tutoring services that will help you enter the Quebec workforce. 
 Learn French 
 Career planning & advice Figure out your career path and meet employers to find job opportunities related to your degree. Career and Planning Services gives personalized career counselling and can help you find a career-related job or internship. Learn more 
 See yourself here 
 An overview of the extra-curricular activities offered beyond the classroom: sports, culture, arts and more. 
 More videos
